column4: I'm in recovery mode right now, it seems the password for my normal account has changed too.
I changed visudo though, so that's fine.
What file is the password for my user account kept in? :(
So what's the command to change my root/user password in terminal?
Also, you guys should get Irssi as an IRC client ;x
I bet you guys can't use IRC in recovery terminal like this :DDD
> that will get you that pak
> r u still there >? u donthaave a root kit problem on your TUX BOX? what r u STORING?
> what on earth. You might want to try to re-root from a LiveCD
> you fooled with some thing called the Plugin Auth Module ? isnt that part of core?
I had to edit my pam so I could join this windows domain, so it would use winbind.
> is there a way u can setup a box that is "always" part of this domain , a port if u will, then just connect in thru that ?

You mean, connect to a computer that's part of the domain and go 'through' it? No thanks; They're all windows machines anyways, I have a feeling I'd have even more trouble. But I disgress, there's a lot of various things that I need to be a part of our domain to do.
